The Breaks \u2013 KUTX.description_highlighted: ...Confucius and Fresh talk about the connection between hip-hop and comedy. Then, inspired by the success of Saucy Santana, they discuss whether hip-hop is ready for an openly gay rapper....
The Breaks \u2013 KUTX.description_original:
Confucius and Fresh talk about the connection between hip-hop and comedy. Then, inspired by the success of Saucy Santana, they discuss whether hip-hop is ready for an openly gay rapper.

You’ll learn Hip-Hop Facts about the collaborative record that DJ Premier and 50 Cent never made, the connection between In Living Color and the Superbowl halftime show, how the introduction of  Soundscan helped hip-hop, and more.

Fresh states the Unpopular Opinion that radio is still a musical gatekeeper.

Confucius talks about NBA Youngboy’s acquittal on gun charges, Desus and Mero’s split, the passage of a bill codifying same-sex marriage in the House of Representatives and more in his Confucius Reads the News segment.

Reasons to be Cheerful with Ed Miliband.rss: Please upgrade to PRO or ENTERPRISE plan to see this field. Learn more: listennotes.com/api/pricing
Reasons to be Cheerful with Ed Miliband.description_highlighted: ...This week we’re back to school and learning all about character education. But what is it and why is it relevant beyond the classroom too?...
Reasons to be Cheerful with Ed Miliband.description_original:
Hello! This week we’re back to school and learning all about character education. But what is it and why is it relevant beyond the classroom too? One of the leading authorities on the topic (the Jubilee Centre) defines character education as all explicit and implicit educational activities that help young people to develop positive personal strengths or ‘virtues’. We explore what ‘good character’ means, the impact of adverse life experiences, and whether character is the key to a fairer and more compassionate society.


We speak to Bec Tigue, Director of School at the University of Birmingham School; Alex Hanratty, co-founder of ReconnectEd; and author and podcaster Bruce Daisley, who questions our typical understanding of resilience.


Plus: Has Ed finally outfoxed the fox?


Our GDPR privacy policy was updated on August 8, 2022. Visit acast.com/privacy for more information.

RN Breakfast - Separate stories podcast.description_original:
The NSW Premier has now lost a second Minister this week, with Stuart Ayres resigning from cabinet and as Deputy Liberal Leader.

He was forced from office in relation to his role in the appointment of former Deputy Premier John Barilaro as the state's Trade Commissioner to the America's.
